[warm] Everyone said I was crazy, you know? नौ साल का कुत्ता shelter से लाना। "Puppy क्यों नहीं?" वो बार-बार पूछते रहे। [chuckle] But when I saw Chester that day, उसकी सफ़ेद होती दाढ़ी और वो... वो थकी हुई आंखें देखकर, कुछ तो click हो गया। [pause] He'd been there eight months. आठ महीने! सोच सकते हो?

[sad] The first week was really tough, honestly. वो खाना नहीं खा रहा था। [sniffle] Just laid in the corner like he was waiting, जैसे वापस भेजे जाने का इंतज़ार कर रहा हो। And I thought maybe I made a mistake? शायद उसे किसी ऐसे व्यक्ति की ज़रूरत थी जो, पता नहीं, जानता हो कि क्या करना है?

[softly] But then one morning something changed. वो बस... sofa पर मेरे पास चढ़ आया। [gasp softly] Not touching me directly, लेकिन पास में। And we just sat there watching TV, और मैं महसूस कर सकता था कि वो, अम्म, धीरे-धीरे relax हो रहा था। हफ़्ता दर हफ़्ता, उसने मुझ पर भरोसा करना शुरू किया।

[very sincerely] You know what I realized later? वो तीन साल जो हमने साथ बिताए, उसके जाने से पहले, मेरी ज़िंदगी के सबसे बेहतरीन साल थे। [cry] He taught me about patience and love, सब्र और बिना शर्त प्यार के बारे में... [pause] Everyone wants the young ones, लेकिन ये बूढ़ी आत्माएं? [passionate] They understand what rescue means. जो कुछ भी उनके पास बचा है, उस पूरे दिल से प्यार करती हैं। [crying while speaking] God, I miss him so much. बहुत याद आता है वो।

original_conversation.content:
[warm] Everyone said I was crazy, you know? Getting a nine-year-old dog from the shelter. "Why not a puppy?" they kept asking. [chuckle] But when I saw Chester that day, with his grey muzzle and these... these tired eyes, something just clicked. [pause] He'd been there eight months. Eight months! Can you imagine? 

[sad] The first week was, um... it was rough, honestly. He wouldn't eat. [sniffle] Just laid in the corner like he was waiting to be sent back. And I thought, oh God, maybe I made a mistake? Maybe he needed someone who, I don't know, knew what they were doing? 

[softly] But then one morning, he just... he climbed onto the couch next to me. [gasp softly] Not touching, but close. And we sat there watching TV and I could feel him, err, slowly relaxing. Week by week, he started trusting me. 

[very sincerely] You know what? Those three years we had together before he passed were the best years of my life. [cry] He taught me about, mmm, about patience and unconditional love and... [pause] Everyone wants the young ones, but these old souls? [passionate] They know what it means to be saved. They love you with everything they've got left. [crying while speaking] God, I miss him so much.

subject: Your decision to adopt an older shelter pet resulted in the most rewarding relationship of your life
